Context(s): Temporal variation in wind speed and wind direction

Part of: Mound

W2052657884:
support, movement, muscular antagonism, and the amplification of the force and displacement of muscle contraction
Mechanism: internal pressure
Context(s): animals and animal structures
Organism: anemones, wormlike invertebrates, tube feet of echinoderms, mammalian and turtle penises, feet of burrowing bivalves and snails, legs of spiders, arms and tentacles of cephalopods, tongue of mammals, and trunk of the elephant
Part of: fluid-filled cavities
Strategy: animals rely on hydrostatic skeletons for support, movement, muscular antagonism, and the amplification of the force and displacement of muscle contraction by internal pressure.
